Sweat beads and drops from his nose and chin as the song, 'ACROSS THE UNIVERSE' begins by The Beatles.  George sets the box down but clings tightly to the model as he closes his eyes. 'Pools of sorrow, waves of joy are drifting through my open mind, possessing them, caressing me...' George drops face first to the cement, crushing the model beneath him.

direction.raw_text: George is probed and poked by doctor after doctor.  An ultrasound test followed by a CT scan, followed by a MRI results in more tests. A flexible tube is slid down George's throat as dye is shot into his body.  'Sounds of laughter, shades of life are ringing through my open view, inciting them, inviting me...' A long blunt needle is shoved into George's side for a biopsy of his pancreas.  X-rays are lit and highlighted as doctors ponder the specks, the disease. Finally, George is opened up; nearly bloodless slice through skin, muscle and fat reveals death. 'Limitless undying love, which shines around me like a million suns, which calls me on and on across the universe...' George is wheeled down a long hall to the critical care unit. 'Nothing's going to change my world, nothing's gonna change my world...'

direction.raw_text: Guster is in a full out run for a rubber ball.  Sam is shirted, sitting at the patio table.  With the ball gladly returned, Sam tosses it again.  George walks out juggling two plates of sandwiches and two Cokes and sits down.

direction.raw_text: Robin focuses on the nearly roofless shack.  Guster walks to the table and sits down by Robin, ready to beg.

direction.raw_text: George sets his sandwich down.

direction.raw_text: George nods.  Though it may appear that Sam isn't interested in the conversation, his ears are perked.

direction.raw_text: Robin inexplicably starts to cry.  She instantly tries to take it back, pressing her hand to her mouth, wiping her eyes, but whatever emotion has her, has her good.  Both George and Sam are confused and concerned.

direction.raw_text: Robin wipes her eyes again as she climbs into her car and drives off.  Sam and George face one another.

direction.raw_text: Sam sets his sandwich down and grabs a slice of pizza as he stands.  He walks for a few feet, stops and turns around.

direction.raw_text: Sam is quick to inhale, but slow to get out.  Josh takes the joint and Sam steps out.  He walks slowly to the Mercedes, opens the door and climbs in.  Josh turns the CD on to Guster's "ALL THE WAY UP TO HEAVEN."  Sam closes the door to the Mercedes.  'He said to only look up, he said to never look down, down is where we came from...' It's an odd song sung in a happy tempo; a whistling refrain overtakes the lyrics as Josh inhales.  'He said to hope for the best and take a load off my chest.  Soon, I could be happy, and go all the way up to heaven and go all the way back home.' With the music loud, Josh misses the police car as it stops behind him without the lights.  Too late for a getaway, he fumbles for his cell phone and tosses the joint out the open window.  The OFFICER approaches the Porsche with his hand on his gun. OFFICER What did you toss into the brush? Josh furtively presses send on his cell phone as he faces the officer with a guilty face.

direction.raw_text: Adam and Ryan are helping Dale run the electrical lines; Alyssa and Sam drill screws into the second story floorboards.  MUSIC is playing loud on the radio.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frustrated and anxious, Colleen slips off the dress she's wearing and tries another one as the phone RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh is standing behind a tree, talking on his cell phone as he stares at George's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slips the phone back in his pocket, hops back on the bike and makes a beeline toward Colleen's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Busted, Josh has no choice but to join Alyssa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alyssa and Sam are leaning out the framed second story window.

direction.raw_text: Sam walks away from the window and goes back to work.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Josh is fuming as he stares at Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam races to George with a hug - something unexpected.  Adam rushes back to work as George breaks into a smile.  Alyssa rushes down the stairs and straight into George's arms.

direction.raw_text: George is still smiling as he tucks a strand of Alyssa's hair behind her ear.  Ryan sort of saunters over to George with his hands sunk deep in his pockets.  Without asking, George wraps his arms around Ryan with a hug.  Afterward:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ryan walks back to Adam, who's been standing still, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George is too quick with his hug.  Josh is stiff as a board. Sam looks pissed as he walks away from the second story window and resumes screwing the floorboards.  George sets his eyes on Dale as he opens his arms wide.

direction.raw_text: George walks toward Dale with his arms still extended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adam and Ryan are excited as George closes the distance. Finally, Dale drops the harmless wire and takes off in a run.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't see her. (beat) Please just open the door when I knock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was hoping...you could..you know.  Go for a ride?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the handlebars or your shoulders?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you afraid of heights?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not really.

dialogue.raw_text: Can you help us out?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I can get you three hundred cash for two hours.

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just a joke.  A stupid joke.

dialogue.raw_text: Josh.

dialogue.raw_text: Me too!

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.  Sorry.

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay.

dialogue.raw_text: She needs to be alone, I think.

dialogue.raw_text: Because Dad left?

dialogue.raw_text: She's a little sad, is all.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't even care if he ever comes back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...I'm okay.  I'm okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't even think about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, they got me started.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I swear to God, I'll use these wires and shock you so bad your tongue will turn black.

direction.raw_text: Colleen is pacing the kitchen in a silky dress we haven't seen before.  Finally, she grabs the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George is propped up on the chaise lounge next to the patio table where everyone has dropped their crap.  Sam and Josh are sheeting the roof with tarpaper.  Robin is still in the garage.  One of two cell phones on the table begins to RING.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess... I don't know.

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Colleen?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) I..I..I.. George?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Is it mine?!

dialogue.raw_text: God, I hope not.

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) That's not mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh, shit!

direction.raw_text: An ambulance is HEARD approaching.  Colleen runs from her house - she's now dressed more appropriately in Levi's and a blouse.

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay.  I'm fine.  Maybe I'll go home.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm an idiot to have you up there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  It's my fault.

dialogue.raw_text: I heard a scream!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I could just stand up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Josh fell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he might have broken a leg.

direction.raw_text: Robin, George and Sam are sitting at the patio table as Ryan and Adam play catch with Guster.

direction.raw_text: Neither Robin nor Sam attempts a response.  Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin stands.  George stands because Robin's standing. Without warning, Robin begins to cry again.  Ryan and Adam stop playing ball.  Sam studies her before finally lowering his eyes.  With her kids looking on, George stands still, hesitant to comfort her.  There's a moment where all that there is, where the only thing seen or heard is Robin's pain. After an awkward amount of time, she wipes her eyes, wipes her nose, crosses around the table to Sam and kisses the top of his head, then his cheek.  Without a word, she walks to her car and climbs in; Ryan and Adam quickly join her in the car.

dialogue.raw_text: Two ribs, a finger, a leg, a bruised kidney and a mild concussion aren't bad considering he landed on brick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I better get the kids home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not a perfect day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: George is brushing his teeth, dribbling and foaming over the only sink in the garage.  Sam is propped up in bed with Guster, dressed on top of the sheets, fingering through a stack of CD's.  He glances over at his father twice before speaking.

direction.raw_text: George spits and rinses, facing Sam as he wipes his mouth.

direction.raw_text: Sam tries to look slightly less interested than he is by continuing to flip through the CD's.  George sits down.

direction.raw_text: This is not easy for George; he fumbles a bit before answering.

dialogue.raw_text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

dialogue.raw_text: I still don't know what that means.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanted you here so we could have a few months together.  Maybe everything happens for a reason.  Something bad to force something good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?  Are you dying?

dialogue.raw_text: I'm having a problem with cancer.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what that means.  What kind of problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

dialogue.raw_text: What?  Are you dying?

dialogue.raw_text: This was all for your sake, wasn't it? Having me here?  Trying to get me to like you.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, congratulations!  You fucking pulled it off!

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to find someone for me.

dialogue.raw_text: Does your son still own a company that builds houses?

Two new men (GREG and MIGUEL) are on the roof, finishing up where Josh fell down.  MUSIC is playing on the radio.  George is asleep on the chaise lounge.  Alyssa walks across the grass and stops to stare at George.  Tears well in her eyes.  Alyssa continues on to the house and walks up the stairs.

direction.raw_text: Robin accepts the answer.  Slowly, they all return to work.

dialogue.raw_text: Will he talk to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kurt finishes hooking in a plugged tee at a turn and stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frustrated, Kurt glances around at all his good work before answering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob opens his clipboard and checks a number of items off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George wakes up and quickly hones in on Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob walks toward George as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George stands, he appears slightly shaky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George sits back down.  Everyone emerges from the house to join George and Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin turns and walks back into the house.  Colleen, Alyssa, Adam and Ryan soon follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Robin picks up the hammer and pounds a nail into a piece of wallboard.  Dale, Miguel, Greg and Kurt walk back to the house and go back to work.  Bob glances at George who shrugs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not a plumber, Kurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I worked every summer with my dad.  Check out what I've done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not whether it's good or bad.  You know that.  It's whether your licensed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you still renting that illegal non conforming studio under your house for a thousand a month?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.  Looks good to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's embarrassing.  That was too easy.  At least look around.  I really did do it right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That isn't why I'm here, anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been dreading you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Stevens.  One of your neighbors is adamant your home has exceeded its approved height.  He's filed to have construction stopped immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's thirty feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if it is, we have a problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have the permit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To the patio and one north-facing window... (suddenly realizing) And six inches to the height.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: David Dokos?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you let your dog crap on his lawn, day after day?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't let him.  He just loves to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll make you tear the entire roof off rather than give you any satisfaction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid you won't be able to continue until this is settled.  You can always go back and file an appeal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That would take weeks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Months.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just so you know, we'll be here working tomorrow and every day after until this house is finished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll call us again and then he'll call the police.  He has an attorney on retainer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just so you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If he hears a hammer, he'll have you arrested.

dialogue.raw_text: I'd be more comfortable if you hadn't slept with Josh.  And George would be more comfortable if he weren't dying.

dialogue.raw_text: Comfort doesn't mean that much when just getting through the night is the goal, Mom.

direction.raw_text: George is shaking and sweating as he tries to crawl off the bed to his sock drawer.  Guster wakes up and hops off Sam's bed to lick George on the face.
